questiontext.text:
Setup instructions

  • Execute the following lines
  • Then answer all question below using the data set cps!
library(AER)
set.seed(6916)
data('CPS1985')
cps <- CPS1985[sample(1:nrow(CPS1985), 150, TRUE),]

Questions

In MCQs, mark the answer choice that best completes the statement, answers the question or is closest to the precise answer.

1. Descriptive statistics

Males have more years of education than females on average in which of the following occupations? {2:MULTIRESPONSE_H:%-33%worker~%33%technical~%-33%services~%-33%office~%33%sales~%33%management}

2. Regression

Estimate a regression model m1 where logarithm of the hourly US$ wage dependents on age and gender.
Use the results to answer the following questions.

  1. Test the hypothesis that both slope coefficients are equal to zero versus the alternative that at least one is not. Provide the corresponding \(p\)-value with all decimal places as inferred from the regression summary. {2:NUMERICAL:%100%0.000155437775579438:1e-05~%10%0.000155437775579438:0.01}

  2. The coefficient of age is {1:MULTICHOICE:%0%statistically significant at the 0.1% level.~%0%statistically significant at the 1% level.~%0%statistically significant at the 5% level.~%0%statistically significant at the 10% level.~%100%not statistically significant.}

  3. How much does the wage of females differ from that of males if they are of the same age? {1:MULTICHOICE:%0%-32.029 %~%0%-0.003 $~%0%0.017 $~%0%-0.325 $~%0%-32.029 $~%0%1.692 $~%0%-32.533 $~%0%0.017 %~%0%1.692 %~%0%-0.32 %~%100%-32.533 %~%0%169.165 %~%0%-0.003 %~%0%-0.325 %~%0%169.165 $~%0%-0.32 $~%0%-0.003 $~%0%-0.003 %}

  4. If the variance of \(u_i\) conditional on age and gender is constant, the regression error term is called {2:SHORTANSWER:%100%homoskedastic~%100%homoscedastic~%50%homoskedasticity~%50%homoscedasticity~%100%homoskedastic~%100%homoscedastic~%50%homoskedasticity~%50%homoscedasticity}
